korean: 오늘은 한 주치 장을 보러 마트에 갔다.
장보기 리스트를 만들어 갔는데도 계획에 없던 것들을 자꾸 담게 되더라.
장바구니에 담다 보니 어느새 카트가 가득 찼어.
야채, 과일, 고기, 우유, 계란 이것저것 다 샀어.
특히 과일 가격이 생각보다 많이 올라서 놀랐어.
사과 몇 개 사는데 만 원이 넘더라고.
계산할 때 금액을 보고 깜짝 놀랐다.
이전에 7만 원 정도 나왔던 것 같은데 오늘은 10만 원 넘게 나왔어.
카드 긁을 때 좀 아깝긴 했지만 어쩔 수 없지.
집에 와서 장 본 거 정리하는 것도 일이더라.
충동구매를 줄이면 돈을 아낄 수 있을 것 같아.
english: I went to the supermarket today to do grocery shopping for the week.
Even though I made a shopping list, I kept adding things that weren't on the plan.
Before I knew it, my cart was full as I kept adding things.
I bought all sorts of stuff - vegetables, fruits, meat, milk, eggs.
I was especially surprised that fruit prices went up more than I thought.
Just buying a few apples cost over 10,000 won.
I was shocked when I saw the total at checkout.
I realized that prices have, like, really gone up a lot.
I think it used to be around 70,000 won before, but today it was over 100,000 won.
I felt kind of wasteful when swiping my card, but I guess there's nothing I can do.
Putting away the groceries after getting home was also work.
But it feels pretty satisfying to have a full fridge.
Next time I should shop more strategically.
I think I can save money if I reduce impulse purchases.
